1: <sup>1</sup> I cried unto the LORD with my voice; with my voice unto the LORD did I make my supplication.
2: <sup>2</sup> I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.
3: <sup>3</sup> When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
4: <sup>4</sup> I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.
5: <sup>5</sup> I cried unto thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
6: <sup>6</sup> Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.
7: <sup>7</sup> Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.
